title: Is it correct that one half of the moon is dark and the second half is bright? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes, same as the Earth. At any one time half the Earth or moon is lit by the sun, the other half is in shadow (ie: night). What’s not correct is that there’s a “dark side” to the moon. The same side of the moon always faces Earth, but the far side gets just as much sun as the near side.  Take a crescent moon like this, for example. The reason we only see a sliver of our side of moon lit up is because most of the sunlight is falling on the far side.

No. It merely spins around its own axis (a moon-day) in the same amount of time ( a month) it takes to complete an orbit around the earth, so that it presents always the same side to us on earth. However, all sides of the moon get illuminated by the sun, most clearly demonstrated by the moon’s phases. When it is ‘new’ moon, (we see the ‘dark side of the moon’), the far side of the moon we never get to see from earth is fully illuminated, at full moon (the earth facing half of the moon is fully illumintaed by the sun, the far side is dark).
